column4: I'm using ubuntu as an internet gate way/firewall.  How can I block internet hostnames - not just IPs - from computers on my lan?
you could use firestarter and add a rule

like only allow traffic to the other services you have and deny evrything else, not sure if it can use names. You could set the systems you want access to use a different IP range, then just ban all IPs which dont fall into that range
